Study: Lymphopenic community acquired pneumonia as signature of severe COVID-19 infection.
Result: 85% of patients critically ill showed lymphopenia. ICU patients suffering this infection had a median lymphocyte count of 800 cells/mm

Study: Critical role of type III interferon in controlling SARS-CoV-2 infection, replication and spread in primary human intestinal epithelial cells
Result: human intestinal epithelial cells fully support SARS-CoV-2 infection, replication and production of infectious de-novo virus particles. viral infection elicited an extremely robust intrinsic immune response where, interestingly, type III interferon mediated response was significantly more efficient at controlling SARS-CoV-2 replication and spread compared to type I interferon

Study: Distinct early IgA profile may determine severity of COVID-19 symptoms: an immunological case series
Result: Severe illness correlated with delayed, but broad SARS-CoV-2-specific IgA response

Study: Single-cell analysis of human lung epithelia reveals concomitant expression of the SARS-CoV-2 receptor ACE2 with multiple virus receptors and scavengers in alveolar type II cells
Result: ACE2-positive AT2 cells that co-express pathogen (including viral) receptors (e.g. DMBT1) with crucial roles in host defense thus comprising plausible phenotypic targets for treatment of COVID-19

Study: The phenotypic changes of γδ T cells in COVID-19 patients
Result: increased expression of CD4 in γδ T cells may serve as a biomarker for the assessment of SARS-CoV-2 infection
Deletion splits ORF8 into ORF8a and ORF8b and is thought to be an adaptive mutation that promotes the switch of hosts

Study: The potential role of IL-6 in monitoring severe case of coronavirus disease 2019
Result: The decrease of IL-6 was closely related to treatment effectiveness, while the increase of IL-6 indicated disease exacerbation
